titleStmt.title: James L. Spalding to James F. Robinson
CWG7972

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
OFFICE OF THE
U.S. Commissary of Subsistence,
Louisville May 26th 1863
Hon James F. Robinson
Governor of Kentucky
Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir.

I enclose you letter from my friend and former Tutor John F Fisk Esqr -- asking appointment of Comissioner of Deeds of Ky for Wm Henry Bird of Messrs Kershaw & Bird Philadelphia Penna. I am personally acquainted with the firm above mentioned and cordially endorse what Mr Fisk says in Mr Bird's favor. Mess Kershaw & Bird are gentlemen of high standing; irreproachable integrity & unswerving loyalty. May I hope that you will accede to Mr Fisk's request.

Letter
Pennsylvania
Jas L. Spalding
Comr of Deeds
Your Comm. send to
W. H. Bird
J. L. S.
Philad
Wm Henry Bird
Appd May 30. 1863.
